attack_summary.cluster_description: The adversary has leveraged a legacy kernel exploit to load a malicious module ('evil_mod') from a suspicious path, enabling root-level privilege escalation. Following the kernel compromise, a backdoor process was dropped and unauthorized container execution via Docker and SSH access were observed, indicating lateral movement and persistence.

cve_details.description: Bug in AMD K6 processor on Linux 2.0.x and 2.1.x kernels allows local users to cause a denial of service (crash) via a particular sequence of instructions, possibly related to accessing addresses outs

A system is running a version of software that was replaced with a Trojan Horse at one of its distribution points, such as (1) TCP Wrappers 7.6, (2) util-linux 2.9g, (3) wuarchive ftpd (wuftpd) 2.2 an
OpenSSH does not properly drop privileges when the UseLogin option is enabled, which allows local users to execute arbitrary commands by providing the command to the ssh daemon.
